      <p>Recent success of Serbian tennis players has led to an immense growth in the popularity of tennis in the country. <a href="/wiki/Novak_Djokovic" title="Novak Djokovic">Novak Djokovic</a> has won seventeen <a href="/wiki/Grand_Slam_(tennis)" title="Grand Slam (tennis)">Grand Slam</a> singles title and has held the <a href="/wiki/List_of_ATP_number_1_ranked_singles_tennis_players" title="List of ATP number 1 ranked singles tennis players">No. 1</a> spot in the ATP rankings for a total of 288 weeks (<a href="/wiki/Open_Era_tennis_records_%E2%80%93_men%27s_singles#ATP_Rankings_achievements" title="Open Era tennis records – men's singles">second</a> of all time). He became the eighth player in history to achieve the <a href="/wiki/Grand_Slam_(tennis)#Career_Grand_Slam" title="Grand Slam (tennis)">Career Grand Slam</a> and the third man to hold all four major titles at once and the first ever to do so on three different <a href="/wiki/Tennis_court" title="Tennis court">surfaces</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-474" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-474">[472]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Ana_Ivanovic" title="Ana Ivanovic">Ana Ivanovic</a> (champion of <a href="/wiki/2008_French_Open" title="2008 French Open">2008 French Open</a>) and <a href="/wiki/Jelena_Jankovi%C4%87" title="Jelena Janković">Jelena Janković</a> were both ranked No. 1 in the WTA Rankings. There were two No. 1 ranked-tennis double players as well: <a href="/wiki/Nenad_Zimonji%C4%87" title="Nenad Zimonjić">Nenad Zimonjić</a> (three-time men's double and four-time mixed double Grand Slam champion) and <a href="/wiki/Slobodan_%C5%BDivojinovi%C4%87" title="Slobodan Živojinović">Slobodan Živojinović</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Serbia_Davis_Cup_team" title="Serbia Davis Cup team">Serbia men's tennis national team</a> won the <a href="/wiki/2010_Davis_Cup" title="2010 Davis Cup">2010 Davis Cup</a> and <a href="/wiki/2020_ATP_Cup" title="2020 ATP Cup">2020 ATP Cup</a>, while <a href="/wiki/Serbia_Fed_Cup_team" title="Serbia Fed Cup team">Serbia women's tennis national team</a> reached the final at <a href="/wiki/2012_Fed_Cup" title="2012 Fed Cup">2012 Fed Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-475" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-475">[473]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Campe%C3%B5es!.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Campe%C3%B5es%21.jpg/300px-Campe%C3%B5es%21.jpg" decoding="async" width="300" height="170" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Campe%C3%B5es%21.jpg/450px-Campe%C3%B5es%21.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Campe%C3%B5es%21.jpg/600px-Campe%C3%B5es%21.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3529" data-file-height="1994"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Campe%C3%B5es!.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Serbia_men%27s_national_water_polo_team" title="Serbia men's national water polo team">Serbia men's national water polo team</a> held <a href="/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_Summer_Olympics" title="Water polo at the Summer Olympics">Olympic Games</a>, <a href="/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_World_Aquatics_Championships" title="Water polo at the World Aquatics Championships">World Championship</a>, <a href="/wiki/European_Water_Polo_Championship" title="European Water Polo Championship">European Championship</a>, <a href="/wiki/FINA_Water_Polo_World_Cup" title="FINA Water Polo World Cup">World Cup</a> and <a href="/wiki/FINA_Water_Polo_World_League" title="FINA Water Polo World League">World League</a> titles simultaneously in period from 2014 to 2016
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Serbia is one of the leading volleyball countries in the world. Its <a href="/wiki/Serbia_men%27s_national_volleyball_team" title="Serbia men's national volleyball team">men's national team</a> won the <a href="/wiki/Volleyball_at_the_2000_Summer_Olympics" title="Volleyball at the 2000 Summer Olympics">gold medal at 2000 Olympics</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Men%27s_European_Volleyball_Championship" title="Men's European Volleyball Championship">European Championship</a> three times as well as the 2016 <a href="/wiki/FIVB_Volleyball_World_League" title="FIVB Volleyball World League">FIVB World League</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Serbia_women%27s_national_volleyball_team" title="Serbia women's national volleyball team">women's national volleyball team</a> are current <a href="/wiki/FIVB_Volleyball_Women%27s_World_Championship" title="FIVB Volleyball Women's World Championship">world Champions</a>, has won <a href="/wiki/Women%27s_European_Volleyball_Championship" title="Women's European Volleyball Championship">European Championship</a> three times as well as <a href="/wiki/Volleyball_at_the_2016_Summer_Olympics_-_Women%27s_tournament" class="mw-redirect" title="Volleyball at the 2016 Summer Olympics - Women's tournament">Olympic silver medal</a> in 2016. </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Jasna_%C5%A0ekari%C4%87" title="Jasna Šekarić">Jasna Šekarić</a>, sport shooter, is one of the athletes with <a href="/wiki/List_of_athletes_with_the_most_appearances_at_Olympic_Games" title="List of athletes with the most appearances at Olympic Games">the most appearances at the Olympic Games</a>. She has won a total of five Olympic medals and also three World Championship gold medals. Other noted Serbian athletes include: swimmers <a href="/wiki/Milorad_%C4%8Cavi%C4%87" title="Milorad Čavić">Milorad Čavić</a> (2009 World championships gold and silver medalist as well as 2008 Olympic silver medalist on 100-metre butterfly in <a href="/wiki/Swimming_at_the_2008_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_100_metre_butterfly" title="Swimming at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's 100 metre butterfly">historic race with American swimmer Michael Phelps</a>) and <a href="/wiki/Na%C4%91a_Higl" title="Nađa Higl">Nađa Higl</a> (2009 World champion in 200-metre breaststroke); track and field athletes <a href="/wiki/Vera_Nikoli%C4%87" title="Vera Nikolić">Vera Nikolić</a> (former <a href="/wiki/800_metres_world_record_progression" title="800 metres world record progression">world record holder</a> in 800 metres) and <a href="/wiki/Ivana_%C5%A0panovi%C4%87" title="Ivana Španović">Ivana Španović</a> (long-jumper; four-time European champion, World indoor champion and bronze medalist at the <a href="/wiki/2016_Olympics" class="mw-redirect" title="2016 Olympics">2016 Olympics</a>); wrestler <a href="/wiki/Davor_%C5%A0tefanek" title="Davor Štefanek">Davor Štefanek</a> (2016 Olympic gold medalist and 2014 World champion), and taekwondoist <a href="/wiki/Milica_Mandi%C4%87" title="Milica Mandić">Milica Mandić</a> (2012 Olympic gold medalist and 2017 world champion). </p>
      <p>Serbia has hosted several major sport competitions, including the <a href="/wiki/2005_EuroBasket" class="mw-redirect" title="2005 EuroBasket">2005 Men's European Basketball Championship</a>, <a href="/wiki/2005_Men%27s_European_Volleyball_Championship" title="2005 Men's European Volleyball Championship">2005 Men's European Volleyball Championship</a>, 2006 and 2016 Men's European Water Polo Championships, <a href="/wiki/2009_Summer_Universiade" title="2009 Summer Universiade">2009 Summer Universiade</a>, <a href="/wiki/2012_European_Men%27s_Handball_Championship" title="2012 European Men's Handball Championship">2012 European Men's Handball Championship</a>, and <a href="/wiki/2013_World_Women%27s_Handball_Championship" title="2013 World Women's Handball Championship">2013 World Women's Handball Championship</a>. The most important annual sporting events held in the country are the <a href="/wiki/Belgrade_Marathon" title="Belgrade Marathon">Belgrade Marathon</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Tour_de_Serbie" title="Tour de Serbie">Tour de Serbie</a> cycling race. </p> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2> 
      <ul>
       <li><a href="/wiki/Index_of_Serbia-related_articles" title="Index of Serbia-related articles">Index of Serbia-related articles</a></li> 
       <li><a href="/wiki/Outline_of_Serbia" title="Outline of Serbia">Outline of Serbia</a></li>
      </ul> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2> 
      <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;"> 
       <div class="mw-references-wrap">
        <ol class="references"> 
         <li id="cite_note-6"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-6">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Hungarian_language" title="Hungarian language">Hungarian</a>: <i lang="hu">Szerbia</i>; <a href="/wiki/Slovak_language" title="Slovak language">Slovak</a> and <a href="/wiki/Czech_language" title="Czech language">Czech</a>: <i lang="sk" title="Slovak-language text">Srbsko</i> <small></small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Slovak" title="Help:IPA/Slovak">[ˈsr̩pskɔ]</a></span>, <small></small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Czech" title="Help:IPA/Czech">[ˈsr̩psko]</a></span>; <a href="/wiki/Pannonian_Rusyn_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Pannonian Rusyn language">Pannonian Rusyn</a>: <span lang="rue" title="Rusyn-language text">Сербия</span>; <a href="/wiki/Romanian_language" title="Romanian language">Romanian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Albanian_language" title="Albanian language">Albanian</a>: <i lang="ro" title="Romanian-language text">Serbia</i>; <a href="/wiki/Bulgarian_language" title="Bulgarian language">Bulgarian</a>: <span lang="bg">Сърбия</span>; <a href="/wiki/Bosnian_language" title="Bosnian language">Bosnian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Croatian_language" title="Croatian language">Croatian</a>: <i lang="hr" title="Croatian-language text">Srbija</i></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-Kosovo-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Kosovo_9-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Kosovo is the subject of a territorial dispute between the <a href="/wiki/Kosovo" title="Kosovo">Republic of Kosovo</a> and the <a class="mw-selflink selflink">Republic of Serbia</a>. The Republic of Kosovo <a href="/wiki/2008_Kosovo_declaration_of_independence" title="2008 Kosovo declaration of independence">unilaterally declared independence</a> on 17 February 2008. <a href="/wiki/Kosovo%E2%80%93Serbia_relations" title="Kosovo–Serbia relations">Serbia continues to claim</a> it as part of its <a href="/wiki/Autonomous_Province_of_Kosovo_and_Metohija" title="Autonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohija">own sovereign territory</a>. The two governments <a href="/wiki/Belgrade%E2%80%93Pristina_negotiations" title="Belgrade–Pristina negotiations">began to normalise relations</a> in 2013, as part of the <a href="/wiki/Brussels_Agreement_(2013)" title="Brussels Agreement (2013)">2013 Brussels Agreement</a>. Kosovo is currently recognized as an independent state by <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">98</a> out of the 193 <a href="/wiki/Member_states_of_the_United_Nations" title="Member states of the United Nations">United Nations member states</a>. In total, <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">113</a> UN member states recognized Kosovo at some point, of which <a href="/wiki/International_recognition_of_Kosovo" title="International recognition of Kosovo">15</a> later withdrew their recognition.</span> </li> 
        </ol>
       </div>
      </div>

         <li id="cite_note-SCGSuccession-13"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-SCGSuccession_13-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-SCGSuccession_13-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120526192918/http://www.dipublico.com.ar/english/yugoslav-agreement-on-succession-issues-2001/">"Yugoslav Agreement on Succession Issues (2001)"</a>. 3 October 2010.          <li id="cite_note-EBRD_Country_Promotion_Programme-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-EBRD_Country_Promotion_Programme_14-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110928025829/http://www.fifoost.org/jugoslaw/yugo.pdf">"FR Yugoslavia Investment Profile 2001"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>.          <li id="cite_note-104"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-104">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFSavich" class="citation news cs1">Savich, Karl. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20121217101508/http://www.pogledi.rs/kragujevac/english/1e.php">"The Kragujevac massacre"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-108"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-108">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-121"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-121">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFUdovickiRidgeway2000" class="citation book cs1">Udovicki, Jasminka; Ridgeway, James (2000). <i>Burn This House: The Making and Unmaking of Yugoslavia</i>.          <li id="cite_note-141"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-141">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFVoltmer2019" class="citation book cs1">Voltmer, Katrin (2019). <i>Media, Communication and the Struggle for Democratic Change: Case Studies on Contested Transitions</i>.          <li id="cite_note-251"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-251">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://abcnews.go.com/International/story?id=83182&amp;page=1">Chinese Migrants Use Serbia as Gate to Europe</a>, ABC News, 13 July 2010.</span> </li>

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFПешиканЈерковићПижурица2010" class="citation book cs1">Пешикан, Митар; Јерковић, Јован; Пижурица, Мато (2010).          <li id="cite_note-CaseNaimark2003-387"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-CaseNaimark2003_387-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-389"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-389">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-434"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-434">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-456"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-456">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20141017043736/http://www.politika.rs/Stranice/O-nama.lt.html">"O nama"</a>.       <div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em"> 
       <ul>
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBataković2005" class="citation book cs1"><a href="/wiki/Du%C5%A1an_T._Batakovi%C4%87" title="Dušan T.                    <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                    <ul>
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Christianity_in_Serbia" title="Christianity in Serbia">Christianity</a> 
                      <ul>
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Serbian_Orthodox_Church" title="Serbian Orthodox Church">Serbian Orthodox Church</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Patriarch_of_the_Serbian_Orthodox_Church" class="mw-redirect" title="Patriarch of the Serbian Orthodox Church">Patriarch</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholicism_in_Serbia" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman Catholicism in Serbia">Roman Catholicism</a></li>
                      </ul></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Hinduism_in_Serbia" class="mw-redirect" title="Hinduism in Serbia">Hinduism</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Islam_in_Serbia" title="Islam in Serbia">Islam</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/History_of_the_Jews_in_Serbia" title="History of the Jews in Serbia">Judaism</a></li>
                    </ul> 
                   </div></td>
                 </tr>
                 <tr>
                  <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%;padding-left:0.5em;padding-right:0.5em;font-weight:normal;"><a href="/wiki/Sport_in_Serbia" title="Sport in Serbia">Sport</a></th>
                  <td class="navbox-list navbox-even" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                   <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">

                     <li>Federations: 
                      <ul>

                       <li><a href="/wiki/Handball_Federation_of_Serbia" title="Handball Federation of Serbia">Handball</a></li>
                      </ul></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Basketball_League_of_Serbia" title="Basketball League of Serbia">Basketball superleague</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Football_in_Serbia" title="Football in Serbia">Football</a></li> 
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Serbia_at_the_Olympics" title="Serbia at the Olympics">Olympics</a></li> 
                     <li><img alt="Category" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/16px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png" decoding="async" title="Category" width="16" height="14" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/24px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/48/Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg/32px-Folder_Hexagonal_Icon.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="36" data-file-height="31"> <a href="/wiki/Category:Serbian_sportspeople" title="Category:Serbian sportspeople">Sportspeople</a></li>

               <tr>
                <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;">
                 <div>
                  <div class="plainlist">
                   <ul>
                    <li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li>
                    <li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li>
                   </ul>
                  </div>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>

               <tr>
                <th scope="col" class="navbox-title" colspan="2">
                 <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r992953826">
                 <div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini">
                  <ul>
                   <li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:European_Union_candidates" title="Template:European Union candidates"><abbr title="View this template" style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;">v</abbr></a></li>
                   <li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:European_Union_candidates" title="Template talk:European Union candidates"><abbr title="Discuss this template" style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;">t</abbr></a></li>
                   <li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:European_Union_candidates&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template" style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;">e</abbr></a></li>

                 <div id="Enlargement_and_partners_of_the_European_Union" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">
                  <a href="/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_European_Union" title="Enlargement of the European Union">Enlargement</a> and <a href="/wiki/European_Neighbourhood_Policy" title="European Neighbourhood Policy">partners</a> of the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>
                 </div></th>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_European_Union#Historical_enlargements" title="Enlargement of the European Union">Previous enlargements</a></th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/1973_enlargement_of_the_European_Communities" title="1973 enlargement of the European Communities">1973</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/1981_enlargement_of_the_European_Communities" title="1981 enlargement of the European Communities">1981</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/1986_enlargement_of_the_European_Communities" title="1986 enlargement of the European Communities">1986</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/1995_enlargement_of_the_European_Union" title="1995 enlargement of the European Union">1995</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/2004_enlargement_of_the_European_Union" title="2004 enlargement of the European Union">2004</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/2007_enlargement_of_the_European_Union" title="2007 enlargement of the European Union">2007</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/2013_enlargement_of_the_European_Union" title="2013 enlargement of the European Union">2013</a></li> 
                   <li><i><a href="/wiki/Statistics_relating_to_enlargement_of_the_European_Union" title="Statistics relating to enlargement of the European Union">Statistics</a></i></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Potential_enlargement_of_the_European_Union" title="Potential enlargement of the European Union">Candidates</a></th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"></div>
                 <table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0">
                  <tbody>
                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Screened</th>
                    <td class="navbox-list navbox-even" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                     <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                      <ul>

                       <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/Flag_of_Morocco.svg/23px-Flag_of_Morocco.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/Flag_of_Morocco.svg/35px-Flag_of_Morocco.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/Flag_of_Morocco.svg/45px-Flag_of_Morocco.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600">&nbsp;</span><a href="/wiki/Morocco" title="Morocco">Morocco</a> <span style="font-size:85%;">(<a href="/wiki/Morocco%E2%80%93European_Union_relations" title="Morocco–European Union relations">relations</a>)</span></li> 
                       <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Flag_of_Palestine.svg/23px-Flag_of_Palestine.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Flag_of_Palestine.svg/35px-Flag_of_Palestine.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Flag_of_Palestine.svg/46px-Flag_of_Palestine.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600">&nbsp;</span><a href="/wiki/State_of_Palestine" title="State of Palestine">Palestine</a> <span style="font-size:85%;">(<a href="/wiki/Palestine%E2%80%93European_Union_relations" title="Palestine–European Union relations">relations</a>)</span></li> 
                       <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Flag_of_Syria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Syria.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Flag_of_Syria.svg/35px-Flag_of_Syria.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Flag_of_Syria.svg/45px-Flag_of_Syria.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600">&nbsp;</span><a href="/wiki/Syria" title="Syria">Syria</a></li> 
                       <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Flag_of_Tunisia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Tunisia.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Flag_of_Tunisia.svg/35px-Flag_of_Tunisia.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ce/Flag_of_Tunisia.svg/45px-Flag_of_Tunisia.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800">&nbsp;</span><a href="/wiki/Tunisia" title="Tunisia">Tunisia</a> <span style="font-size:85%;">(<a href="/wiki/Tunisia-European_Union_relations" class="mw-redirect" title="Tunisia-European Union relations">relations</a>)</span></li>
                      </ul> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                  </tbody>
                 </table>
                 <div></div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Other geographically<br>European countries</th>

                  </ul>

               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Members</th>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Structure</th>

                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Summits</th>
                    <td class="navbox-list navbox-even" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">

                       <li><a href="/wiki/Bandung_Conference" title="Bandung Conference">Bandung Conference</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Non-Aligned_Foreign_Ministers_Conference" title="Non-Aligned Foreign Ministers Conference">Non-Aligned Foreign Ministers Conference</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/16th_Summit_of_the_Non-Aligned_Movement" title="16th Summit of the Non-Aligned Movement">16th Summit of the Non-Aligned Movement</a></li>
                      </ul> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Founders</th>
                    <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                     <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                      <ul>
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Josip_Broz_Tito#Non-Alignment" title="Josip Broz Tito">Josip Broz Tito</a> (<a href="/wiki/Yugoslavia" title="Yugoslavia">Yugoslavia</a>)</li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Sukarno#Figurehead_president" title="Sukarno">Sukarno</a> (<a href="/wiki/Indonesia" title="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>)</li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Jawaharlal_Nehru" title="Jawaharlal Nehru">Jawaharlal Nehru</a> (<a href="/wiki/India" title="India">India</a>)</li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Kwame_Nkrumah" title="Kwame Nkrumah">Kwame Nkrumah</a> (<a href="/wiki/Ghana" title="Ghana">Ghana</a>)</li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Gamal_Abdel_Nasser#Adoption_of_neutralism" title="Gamal Abdel Nasser">Gamal Abdel Nasser</a> (<a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">Egypt</a>)</li>
                      </ul> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                   <tr>
